attributes.action: Cap rental charges for properties in inner city areas.
attributes.additional_details: With rental prices spiralling out of control, and less affordable housing available, Landlords are taking advantage of those desperate to secure a home by charging overcharging. Many people will be priced out of areas they have lived their entire lives, and others will never be able to save for a mortgage because they are spending over 75% of the monthly wage on rent. A landlord is not an occupation and they should not be profiting off of their fellow citizens most basic human rights
attributes.background: The govt must step in to ensure private landlords are not over charging for what many see as a basic human right, a place to live. The government must set out fixed caps on rental charges based of the average income of the area.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Introduce a regulator for private landlords and caps for rent: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/589028

Create a rent cap of £700 PCM and give extra protections to renters: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/576340

Create a rent cap of £250 PCM per bedroom: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/585466
